alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 3:35PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX EXPECTED FOR SOUTHWEST ALASKA THROUGH THE WEEKEND... A series of weak fronts will move through Southwest Alaska this weekend, each bringing multiple types of precipitation. Snow has developed this afternoon along the Southwest coast and is pushing into the interior of Southwest in advance of the first front. A brief period of freezing rain is possible for these areas Saturday evening as warmer air moves overhead. Any ice accumulations are expected to be less than five hundredths of an inch, with areas between Togiak and Kipnuk and being the most likely to receive any freezing rain. Impacts are expected to be minimal as winds will become southerly on Sunday, warming temperatures above freezing and transitioning remaining precipitation to all rain. Another much warmer front will move into the region mid-day on Sunday. This will produce widespread rain with temperatures in the mid to upper 30s. The higher chance of freezing rain will shift into the Lower Kuskokwim Valley, potentially bringing light freezing rain to villages from Aniak east. Impacts are expected to be minimal with all areas likely to be in the mid to upper 30s by Monday; however, warm temperatures and rain may result in slick conditions throughout the area by early next week as compacted snow begins to melt.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
